title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message:
Got this heavy liquid damaged mac air. Have solved power issues but this sensor problem has got me.
Run ASD EFI and these sensors fail ThunderBolt Proximity, S2 Camera Proximity, AirPort Proximity, Memory Proximity and Trackpad Skin.

Keyboard and trackpad work in ASD but not in OS. Any ideas? Already checked u5800 and u5810 everything looks ok in those areas

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: This sounds like a fun one. i would check to see if they all share a power rail that is screwed up. then check in asd efi the hardware profiler for the incorrect readings and report them here. could be that because of the amount of water damage multiple sensors have different issues.

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: Check U5810. Even if it looks nice, replace. Make sure continuity is good in that area as well. If that doesn't resolve (it should), then SMC would be next to check.

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message:
Can't seem to find the sensors on the MLB and I dont have the schematic for the io board maybe theyre on there? would have thought memory proximity would be there though.

All read -124 in hardware profile.

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: Thanks will have to order this chip since i dont have a donor for it yet. in the meantime i'll check everything else in the area.

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: With board oriented with I/O ports to the right, U5810 is the larger 8-legged IC to the top-right (1:00) of the SMC. If the liquid damage was anywhere near that IC, I'd replace it. It has a ton of sensor data (including the ones you mentioned) running through to/from the SMC.

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: -124 is a problem of not seeing the sensor, which is usually and sm bus data line issue. check for corrosion around web cam connector, trackpad connector, etc. you may need to check for continuity on these lines as well.

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: The trackpad not working in OS is a tell tale sign of something wrong in the trackpad connector. Check connector for corrosion, replace trackpad/cable.

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: Thanks, everything around its measuring ok, will replace the ic when replacements arrive

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: All the connectors are corrosion free inside and out. Will check sm bus data lines for continuity

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message:
Checked under battery and sure enough corrosion on the connector to the MLB, cleaned it off it now works in OS but sensors all still read -124

Tried unplugging trackpad from MLB now all sensors expect trackpad obviously read normal. It's safe to say that trackpad was cause of all this?

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message:
Tried unplugging trackpad from MLB now all sensors expect trackpad obviously read normal. It's safe to say that trackpad was cause of all this?

Don't have known good trackpad to test, should have some on the weekend

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: Usually the cable is fucked, but TP could also be bad. 13" and 11" TP will both work for testing. Cable is first suspect.

title: [SOLVED]820-3435-B sensor problems
message: Great all working fine now used a cable from 13" to test
